709272f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Downing Street.
709272f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, at Downing Street, showing a panora-
mic arrangement that individually depicts the S. W. and N. W.
corners. To the right is Bleecker Street. Upon same, at Carmine
Street, appears the new Church of Our Lady of Pompeii. This or-
ganization was formerly located in the foreground, this side of
the used car lot; a site now included in the roadway. On the ex-
tension of 6th Avenue, they were forced to vacate, as the new
thoroughfare incorporated their holdings. Their new home was con-
structed one block to the north.
Anril 30, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

719340f-a.title: Manhattan: Downing Street - 6th Street
719340f-a.text:
22 to 12 Downing Street, south side, west of and twaards Sixth
Avenue.
April 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709273f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Downing Street.
709273f-a.text:
Sixth Ave. (Extension), west side, at Downing Street. The old, 2 1V2-
story gabled house,(on the extreme left, the side of which is covered by the
Sunkist advertisement), is No. 12 Downing Street. Also seen, is the N.W.
corner of DoNning. which is now a children's playground; built by the WW.P.A.
At the extreme right, are seen the rears of buildings facing on the south side
of Carmine Street.
October 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

730323f-a.title: General view - 6th Avenue - Northwest.
730323f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from Sixth Ave., and Bleecker Street.
October 19, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
730323f-a.folder: Bleecker Street and 6th Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.

709281f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Bleecker Street.
709281f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue-Extension, south from Bleecker Street, showing
the slice-through that eliminated Hancock Street from Manhattan
Imaps. Under construction is the Municipal subway. Tbe center
foreground was the former site of the R. C. Church of Our Lady of
Pompeii (St. Carlos Missionary Fathers). On the left are seversl
six story apartment houses, that formerly bore No's. 1-3, 5-7 and
9-13 Hancock Street. These will remain, acquiring 6th Avenue
identities. On the extreme right is the rear of the Dowhing Street
site, upon which in 1941 will rise a modern apartment structure,
No. 10 Downing Street. The new west line of the Avenue will run
there, forming the easterly side of this building plot. The
partially demolished 6-story structures shown there front on West
Houston Street. They will remain. Through the center is Congress
Street, a short thoroughfare extending south of West Houston to
King Street. This is to be included in the new thoroughfare.
709281f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Bleecker Street., Manhattan, NY

709282f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Bleecker Street.
709282f-a.text:
Dipping Tar for Subway work-- East side of Sixth Avenue, south
of Bleeker Street.
October 11, 1928.
P.L.Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
709282f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Bleecker Street., Manhattan, NY

709284f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Bleecker Street.
709284f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from Bleecker Street, showing
that odd corner formed by Minetta Street (right) and Minetta Lane
(left). Nestling here was the former Minetta Place. This would
be about where the tool shacks appear. Most of the buildings are
gOne, though two remain, No's. 20 and 22 Minetta Street. The vac-
ant space to the left of these is to be the site of a new 6-story
apartment house according to the New York Times of December 16, 1939.
Across this cleared site are buildings on the north side of Minetta
Lane. Towering above are apartments on Washington Square. Behind
the sign board on the right is the peculiar bend in Minetta Street.
April 13, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NNO REPRODUCTIOSSS
(3)
A southeastward view towards Minetta Lane (center) showing
the aforementioned apartment house completed. West 3rd Street is
on the left and does not appear. To the right is Minetta Street
flowing into 6th Avenue at Bleecker Street. The latter is not
included.
August 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
709284f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Bleecker Street., Manhattan, NY

709287f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Bleecker Street.
709287f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from Bleecker Street, showing
the Sixth Avenue ''E1'' bend at W. 3rd Street. Carmine
Street is at the left and Minetta Lane nt the rirht.
View 2 is limited to the Hinetta Lane to W. 3rd
Street frontage. This was developed as a play arca in
1938. The old type houses shown are No's. 136 and 138
W. 3rd Street. Above same is the distinctive apartment
hhouse, No. 1 Fifth Avenue.
March 25, 1933
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUTTIONS
